greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Murata's constant Product_{p prime}(1 + 1/(p-1)^2).
link: Leo Murata, On the magnitude of the least prime primitive root, Journal of Number Theory, Vol. 37, No. 1 (1991), pp. 47-66.
G. Niklasch, Some number theoretical constants: 1000-digit values [Cached copy]
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Murata's Constant
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Prime Products
formula: Equals lim_{k->oo} (1/pi(k)) * Sum_{p prime, p <= k} (p-1)/phi(p-1), where pi(k) = A000720(k) and phi(k) = A000010(k) (Murata, 1991). - _Amiram Eldar_, Jul 31 2020
mathematica: digits = 99; terms = 1000; $MaxExtraPrecision = 500; r[n_Integer] := 2 - (1-I)^(n+1) - (1+I)^(n+1); NSum[r[n-1]*PrimeZetaP[n]/n, {n, 2, terms}, NSumTerms -> terms, WorkingPrecision -> digits+10] // Exp // RealDigits[ #, 10, digits]& // First (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 16 2016 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 19 2001; edited Sep 16 2007 at the suggestion of _R. J. Mathar_
